alert.note: Alert for Lawrence; Washington (Ohio) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued April 13 at 11:42PM EDT by NWS Charleston
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of Meigs, eastern Gallia, western Washington, southeastern Morgan, southeastern Athens, east central Lawrence and Mason Counties through 1215 AM EDT... At 1141 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from near Athens to near Rutland to 14 miles southwest of Gallipolis. Movement was northeast at 50 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Athens, Point Pleasant, Gallipolis, Pomeroy, Beverly, Racine, Coolville, Rutland, Chesterhill, Forked Run State Park, New Haven, Mason, Tuppers Plains, Washington, Middleport, Chester, Syracuse, Hartford City, Stockport and Henderson. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. To report severe weather, contact your nearest law enforcement agency. They will relay your report to the National Weather Service office in Charleston West Virginia.
